The patient is intubated and unable to provide history. Nurses report the area was first noticed to be darker and then rapidly expanded. Review of current medications include cyclosporine, tacrolimus, insulin, and broad spectrum antibiotics. Physical examination reveals an extensive dark black, necrotic eschar on the nasal bridge and left nasal sidewall, cheek, and lip with surrounding pink erythema. Oral examinatination reveals black eschars on upper palate.
